content: I wanted to like this. But I can’t. Chasing eyeballs isn’t the right way to write meaningful content —though I’m sure it’s a nice dopamine spike when it works. Publishers chase eyeballs to remain relevant, because news topics shift constantly. You can see the streams on Reddit and HackerNews as well. My point is, good writing should be written by someone with passion, not in response to a question in exchange for some attention from the next Yahoo answers nor written about on the future Blogger. (I gave you a heart anyway, just because.)
